question: What to do about aching jaw?
question_content: Well, almost every night I wake myself up clenching my jaw, it's hard to describe, it's weird... It's like I'm dreaming but it hurts and it's an annoying sorta feeling. Every now and then my jaw aches but today it was sooo painful I could of cried.. I was at school, so I told my teacher and she said she had the same problem as me she was grinding her teeth while sleeping so she said I should get a mouth guard while sleeping. It's really weird, I can't describe how it feels when I'm sleeping, I know I do it I just can't figure how what exactly it is and why! I'm 14 year old girl anyway :)

answers.answer_content:
Well I'm 13 and I had TMJ when I was 12. It's the feeling that you can't open your jaw wide enough because it is sort of stuck. It is sometimes annoying, sometimes painful. I went to the doctor and they gave me a mouth guard to wear for a month and a retainer to wear for like.. 2 months I think? I still have it now but it is way way better. 

So my advice is... go visit the doctor I guess. I hope I helped :)
That's weird that you are having pain in your jaw and you are just 14! Well, you should consult a doctor. You should paste your teeth before sleeping! :P
